item.title: To amend title 36, United States Code, to require Presidential Inaugural Committees to file disbursement reports with the Federal Election Commission, to prohibit such Committees from disbursing funds for purposes unrelated to the inauguration of the President, to require such Committees to donate any Committee funds which remain available at the time the Committee terminates, and for other purposes.

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Presidential Inaugural Committee Oversight Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 28 (Tuesday, February 13, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SCHRADER:H.R. 5008.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:U.S. Const. art. 1, Sec. 8, cl. 18;[Page H1126]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bill.title: Presidential Inaugural Committee Oversight Act

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
